messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Hawley abbreviations
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks, Bob.  Note that Hawley has a typo.  Should be S171. ... From: Bob Elder To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com Sent: Wednesday, April 06, 2005 7:37 PM
messages.messageBody:
Thanks, Bob. Note that Hawley has a typo. Should be "S171."
----- Original Message -----
From: Bob Elder
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, April 06, 2005 7:37 PM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Hawley abbreviations


"S181" would indicate an example of the signature in
Fuji Shiro's Shinto edition. "J" means some have gone
Juto. BOb Elder
--- David Zincavage <jdz@...> wrote:

>
> I have the brown 1981 single volume Hawley. On page
> 570, second entry from the bottom, there are three
> interlinear abbrevations: "S181" -- "TK467" (Toko
> Taikan?) -- and "J." Can anyone identify them?
> Hawley does not.
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been
> removed]
>
>

messages.subject: Hawley abbreviations
messages.msgSnippet: I have the brown 1981 single volume Hawley.  On page 570, second entry from the bottom, there are three interlinear abbrevations:  S181 -- TK467 (Toko
messages.messageBody:
I have the brown 1981 single volume Hawley. On page 570, second entry from the bottom, there are three interlinear abbrevations: "S181" -- "TK467" (Toko Taikan?) -- and "J." Can anyone identify them? Hawley does not.

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
